intro: Renealmia ivorensis, commonly known as the Ivorian grass, is a tropical plant native to West Africa. It belongs to the grass family, Poaceae, and is characterized by its tall, slender stalks and narrow leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in humid climates. It is often found in savannas and along riverbanks, where it contributes to the local ecosystem. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
